item.title: Senior Expert 1- Justice Sector Reform
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
To enhance the process of identification and formulation of EU support to the justice sector, the following specific objectives have been identified:

  • Establishing a comprehensive an informed analysis of the distribution and operation of power and of key aspects of political, social and economic practice, vision, organisation and interactions in the justice sector in Azerbaijan.
  • Contributing to the future EU programming and policy dialogue in the justice sector, by identifying the scope, obstacles, opportunities and entry points for productive policy dialogue and EU support on justice reform.
  • Providing internal document to better understand the developments in Justice sector for EU staff working both at the Delegation and at Headquarters, as well as selected development partners active in the justice sector in Azerbaijan.

Senior Expert 1- Justice Sector Reform

Qualifications and skills:

  • Masters-level degree in Political Science, Law, Development Studies, Economics Social Sciences or another relevant areas, or equivalent 15 years of relevant professional experience;
  • Fluent in English, orally and in writing. Command of Russian or Azeri will be an asset.

General professional experience:

A minimum of 10 years relevant professional experience in the sectors of justice and rule of law .

Specific professional experience:

  • A minimum of 5 years of experience in Justice Sector Reform in developing or transition countries, preferably in the Eastern Neighbourhood region and/or current or past EU candidate countries.* A minimum of 3 years of experience in policy analysis and planning;
  • Previous experience in designing, implementing, monitoring and/or evaluating Justice Reform programs
  • Expertise in drafting programming documents for EU or other donors

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Partnerships Development Manager – SEED Pacific
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Australian Government recently established the innovationXchange to drive innovation throughout Australia’s aid program so that it becomes an intrinsic way of thinking and acting. The innovationXchange will create and test development innovations, source new ideas for the wider aid program, and work with the private sector to find more creative and clever ways to achieve better results.

The Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) works constructively with the private sector in the Pacific in many ways, seeing both successes and opportunities for learning. DFAT has therefore developed SEED Pacific, an innovative initiative that seeks to harness the collective power of business and society to solve development challenges in the Pacific. SEED Pacific will target businesses that are prepared to show leadership and innovation in the Pacific and will broker and support the most promising partnerships between global businesses and local organisations to develop new business solutions that have a development impact.

Organisations will receive:

  • Support to tailor their business solutions to the Pacific
  • Networking opportunities and links to strategic partners
  • Opportunities to develop business solutions in collaboration
  • Match funding for the best business solutions identified through a competitive process

The objectives of SEED Pacific are to:

  • Source, test and scale new business ideas that solve development challenges in the Pacific
  • Work in an innovative way with partners to create and implement the Initiative and the business solutions
  • Forge new multi-sector partnerships with Pacific-based organisations
  • Leverage private sector finance for development outcomes
  • Learn from failures as much as successes

Scope of Work:

The Partnerships Development Manager will be responsible for maintaining and developing existing partnerships, whilst also identifying new organisations to work with. S/he will take a leading role liaising with partners to develop, deliver and evaluate projects.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Degree level education or equivalent.
  • A demonstrable understanding of development issues in the Pacific region.
  • Experience of managing relationships with private and public sector organisations.
  • An ability to analyse and present information clearly and concisely.
  • Demonstrable ability to organise workload.
  • Demonstrable ability to communicate at a high level, both verbally and in writing
  • Demonstrable ability to work as part of a team and on own initiative
  • Experience of travelling and working in Australia and the Pacific region
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Word, Access and Excel

How to apply: If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/SEEDS/Partnerships in the subject line of your email.

“Please note that all profiles are indicative only and therefore subject to change once the ToR is made available.”

item.title: Operations and Grants Manager – SEED Pacific
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Australian Government recently established the innovationXchange to drive innovation throughout Australia’s aid program so that it becomes an intrinsic way of thinking and acting. The innovationXchange will create and test development innovations, source new ideas for the wider aid program, and work with the private sector to find more creative and clever ways to achieve better results.

The Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) works constructively with the private sector in the Pacific in many ways, seeing both successes and opportunities for learning. DFAT has therefore developed SEED Pacific, an innovative initiative that seeks to harness the collective power of business and society to solve development challenges in the Pacific. SEED Pacific will target businesses that are prepared to show leadership and innovation in the Pacific and will broker and support the most promising partnerships between global businesses and local organisations to develop new business solutions that have a development impact.

Organisations will receive:

  • Support to tailor their business solutions to the Pacific
  • Networking opportunities and links to strategic partners
  • Opportunities to develop business solutions in collaboration
  • Match funding for the best business solutions identified through a competitive process

The objectives of SEED Pacific are to:

  • Source, test and scale new business ideas that solve development challenges in the Pacific
  • Work in an innovative way with partners to create and implement the Initiative and the business solutions
  • Forge new multi-sector partnerships with Pacific-based organisations
  • Leverage private sector finance for development outcomes
  • Learn from failures as much as successes

Scope of Work:

The Operations Manager will support the Team Leader by providing operational support through the management of uniform and integrated financial, procurement, administrative, logistical, and human resource management functions necessary for flexible program implementation. S/He will be responsible for ensuring project compliance with all DAI procedures, DFAT regulations and other key documents, ensuring value for money in all procurements.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Operational experience in financial management and procurement for Government contracts.
  • Client focused and solution oriented.
  • Office management experience including coordinating administrative, logistical, human resource management and program management functions, and office establishments.
  • Understanding of multi-jurisdiction program management and use of decentralised management systems to mitigate operational risks.
  • Ability to develop relationships and inspire multi-country national and international teams.
  • Experience preparing official procedures and reports, using a consultative and analytical approach.
  • A high degree of personal initiative, lateral thinking, and ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
  • High level of knowledge of Microsoft Office, in particular spreadsheet applications.

How to apply: If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/SEEDS/Operations in the subject line of your email.

“Please note that all profiles are indicative only and therefore subject to change once the ToR is made available.”

item.title: Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Manager – SEED Pacific
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Australian Government recently established the innovationXchange to drive innovation throughout Australia’s aid program so that it becomes an intrinsic way of thinking and acting. The innovationXchange will create and test development innovations, source new ideas for the wider aid program, and work with the private sector to find more creative and clever ways to achieve better results.

The Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) works constructively with the private sector in the Pacific in many ways, seeing both successes and opportunities for learning. DFAT has therefore developed SEED Pacific, an innovative initiative that seeks to harness the collective power of business and society to solve development challenges in the Pacific. SEED Pacific will target businesses that are prepared to show leadership and innovation in the Pacific and will broker and support the most promising partnerships between global businesses and local organisations to develop new business solutions that have a development impact.

Organisations will receive:

  • Support to tailor their business solutions to the Pacific
  • Networking opportunities and links to strategic partners
  • Opportunities to develop business solutions in collaboration
  • Match funding for the best business solutions identified through a competitive process

The objectives of SEED Pacific are to:

  • Source, test and scale new business ideas that solve development challenges in the Pacific
  • Work in an innovative way with partners to create and implement the Initiative and the business solutions
  • Forge new multi-sector partnerships with Pacific-based organisations
  • Leverage private sector finance for development outcomes
  • Learn from failures as much as successes

Scope of Work:

The M&E Manager will lead the design and implementation of an M&E strategy, including the coordination of M&E resources to ensure efficient administration of any surveys, data collection and other qualitative and quantitative activities. S/He will work closely with the project team to disseminate information and share feedback on pilot activities.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Tertiary degree in a relevant discipline and over 10 years’ experience in monitoring and evaluation in development contexts.
  • A demonstrable understanding of development issues in the Pacific region.
  • Experience of designing and managing large-scale M&E activities.
  • An ability to analyse and present information clearly and concisely.
  • Demonstrable ability to organise workload.
  • Demonstrable ability to communicate at a high level, both verbally and in writing
  • Demonstrable ability to work as part of a team and on own initiative
  • Experience in working with Pacific regional organisations (desirable)
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Word, Access and Excel

How to apply:

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV in DFAT format with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/SEEDS/M&E in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

item.description:

The innovationXchange will create and test development innovations, source new ideas for the wider aid program, and work with the private sector to find more creative and clever ways to achieve better results.

The Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) works constructively with the private sector in the Pacific in many ways, seeing both successes and opportunities for learning. DFAT has therefore developed SEED Pacific, an innovative initiative that seeks to harness the collective power of business and society to solve development challenges in the Pacific. The Communications Manager will be responsible for keeping employees and external stakeholders informed of the project developments. item.title: Un experto en bases de datos y estadísticas en la área de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Objetivo general

Fortalecimimento del Sistema de Innovacion, Ciencia y Tecnologia de Uruguay

Objetivos específicos

  • La Identificación de Centros Científicos Europeos de Investigación. (en adelante CCEI).

Identificación de CCEI de primer nivel, a los cuales ofrecer condiciones ventajosas para su instalación en Uruguay, en función del capital de técnicos e investigadores existentes y potencialmente disponibles localmente.

  • La detección de áreas de vacancia de I+D según la perspectiva del sector productivo

Relevar las áreas de vacancia de I+D y cuantificar las necesidades de recursos humanos científicos y técnicos según la perspectiva del sector productivo. Se pretende que este relevamiento sirva de insumo para el diseño de los aspectos de Política Científica del país en temas de formación de recursos humanos en áreas técnicas y de I+D.

  • Elaboración de una propuesta para la creación de un observatorio de CTI que corresponda a las necesidades y posibilidades del país

Se tienen que involucrar a representantes de las instituciones demandantes de información desde la etapa de diseño, asegurando, desde el corto plazo, la progresiva generación y sistematización de información adecuada a los requerimientos de los procesos de evaluación de políticas e instrumentos, planificación estratégica, definición de políticas, toma de decisión y asignación de recursos en materia de CTI.

*Experto categoría III Un experto en bases de datos y estadísticas en la área de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación *

Calificaciones: Profesional universitario (nivel mínimo grado en Informática).

Experiencia general: Al menos 5 años de experiencia en manejo de bases de datos y estadísticas.

Experiencia específica: Conocimiento de las instituciones nacionales en CTI y de las bases de datos que manejan las mismas.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to roxanne_garrana@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.author: Penny Buckle

Fortalecimimento del Sistema de Innovacion, Ciencia y Tecnologia de Uruguay

Objetivos específicos

  • La Identificación de Centros Científicos Europeos de Investigación. (en adelante CCEI).

Identificación de CCEI de primer nivel, a los cuales ofrecer condiciones ventajosas para su instalación en Uruguay, en función del capital de técnicos e investigadores existentes y potencialmente disponibles localmente.

  • La detección de áreas de vacancia de I+D según la perspectiva del sector productivo

Relevar las áreas de vacancia de I+D y cuantificar las necesidades de recursos humanos científicos y técnicos según la perspectiva del sector productivo. Se pretende que este relevamiento sirva de insumo para el diseño de los aspectos de Política Científica del país en temas de formación de recursos humanos en áreas técnicas y de I+D.

  • Elaboración de una propuesta para la creación de un observatorio de CTI que corresponda a las necesidades y posibilidades del país

Se tienen que involucrar a representantes de las instituciones demandantes de información desde la etapa de diseño, asegurando, desde el corto plazo, la progresiva generación y sistematización de información adecuada a los requerimientos de los procesos de evaluación de políticas e instrumentos, planificación estratégica, definición de políticas, toma de decisión y asignación de recursos en materia de CTI.

*Experto categoría III - Un experto en gestión de organizaciones gubernamentales *

Calificaciones: Profesional universitario (nivel mínimo MSc, MEng) Experiencia general: Al menos 3 años de experiencia (europea a nivel mínimo regional, o uruguaya exclusivamente a nivel nacional) en administración y gestión a nivel gerencial de organizaciones gubernamentales en temas de demanda empresarial de recursos humanos de alta calificación. Experiencia específica: Se valorará especialmente su experiencia internacional como articulador entre oferta y demanda de trabajo en los sectores estratégicos definidos en el subcomponente B.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to roxanne_garrana@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

*Experto categoría II - Un experto en Sistemas Nacionales de Innovación *

Calificaciones: Formación universitaria a nivel de grado (en ciencias sociales o ingenierías). Se valorará un título de postgrado en áreas afines a la consultoría.

Experiencia general: Al menos 6 años de experiencia profesional en áreas relacionadas al contrato.

Experiencia específica: Amplio conocimiento del Sistema Nacional de Innovación, en particular de las políticas, programas y estructuras cognitivas existentes en el país.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to roxanne_garrana@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

Experiencia específica: Se valorará especialmente la experiencia del consultor en instancias concretas de trasnacionalización de Centros Cientificos de investigación, preferentemente europeos

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to roxanne_garrana@dai.com

Experto categoría I – Experto en Indicadores en el área de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación

Calificaciones: Formación universitaria nivel de grado y de posgrado. Experiencia general: Al menos 12 años de experiencia profesional general en temas relacionados con la consultoría.

Experiencia específica: Amplio conocimiento de al menos tres instituciones a nivel mundial que tengan como cometido la construcción de indicadores de CTI evaluación de políticas públicas en CTI, prospectiva y vigilancia tecnológica.

Amplio conocimiento de la institucionalidad seleccionada en al menos tres organizaciones en el mundo con cometidos similares a lo que se pretende crear en el país.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to roxanne_garrana@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

Experiencia especifica: Se busca que el consultor cuente con actuación a nivel gerencial en CCEI (preferentemente europeos con presencia internacional) demostrando su experiencia en la gestión de la interfase entre éstos y el sector empresarial. Se valorará especialmente su experiencia internacional en el diagnóstico y la articulación entre la oferta académica / técnica de recursos humanos y su demanda por parte del sector productivo / empresarial en los sectores estratégicos definidos en el subcomponente B

item.title: Senior Electoral Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Election Follow-up Mission to Cambodia

Senior Electoral Expert (Category I)

  • Master’s degree in Law, Political Science, International Relations or any other discipline relevant to the assignment, or equivalent professional experience of over 12 years in the area related to Lot 7.

  • At least 12 years in the field of electoral assistance and in the sector(s) directly related to the Lot 7.

  • at least 5 years in the specific field of the electoral assistance, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission and/or an EU Election Technical Assistance project;

  • Proficiency in electoral issues in developing countries;

  • Excellent knowledge of all issues related to the evaluation of electoral assistance projects;

  • Previous experience in the country and/or the region is an asset;

  • Adaptability to a multicultural working environment.

  • Excellent written and spoken skills in English.

Further requirements:

  • Experience and deep knowledge of Cambodia political and electoral situation,
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of voter registration processes and * Very good knowledge and understanding of legal framework for the election process will be considered an asset.

Timing: for around 21 working days (18 days in country including briefing, debriefing in Brussels and travel days and followed by 3 home-based days for the finalization and editing of the Final Report, including travels) - focusing on programming and planning issues connected to electoral assistance projects, assessing the strengths and limitations of projects to promote and implement reform, providing guidance on the design of future projects based on EU EOM recommendations, including targeted recommendations for short term EU support to forthcoming elections.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to francesca_giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Political Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Election Follow-up Mission to Cambodia Election Follow-up Mission to Cambodia

One Political Expert (Category I)

  • Master’s degree in Law, Political Science, International Relations or any other discipline relevant to the assignment, or equivalent professional experience of over 12 years in the area related to Lot 7.
  • At least 12 years of experience in the area related to Lot 7.
  • Approximately 5 years work experience in the field of electoral assistance and electoral observation and analysis, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission and/or an EU Election Technical Assistance project, possibly including managing an electoral observation mission, drafting statements and reports;
  • Familiarity with the national legal and regulatory framework for elections, including the issue of voter registration, as well as international and regional standards for elections. In this context the “Compendium of International Standards for Elections” is an important background document;
  • Proven work experience on and good understanding of the establishment of electoral lists and voter registration;
  • Excellent understanding of the functioning of election management bodies;
  • Experience in assessing the media landscape and media framework according to international and regional standards;

  • Previous experience in the country and/or the region, and good networks within the different sectors of society in order to be immediately operational is an asset;

  • Excellent written and spoken skills in English

  • Excellent communication and inter-personal skills;

  • Excellent report drafting skills;

  • Coordination and management skills and past experience of management in a similar assignment, preferably as Deputy Chief Observer in an Election observation mission or as Chief Technical Adviser in a technical assistance project;

  • Proven knowledge and field experience of EU policies and programmes in the area of human rights, democratisation and good governance;

  • Proven work experience in project implementation and budget management of international civilian missions, preferably as part of an EU Election Observation Mission or an EU Election Technical Assistance project is an asset;

  • Proven familiarity with contractual and budgetary procedures of EU external action and related mechanisms is an asset.

Other Requirements:

  • Experience and deep knowledge of Cambodia political and electoral situation
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of voter registration processes and
  • Very good knowledge and understanding of legal framework for the election process will be considered an asset.

Timing: for around 21 working days (18 days in country including briefing, debriefing in Brussels and travel days and followed by 3 home-based days for the finalization and editing of the Final Report, including travels) - overseeing the analysis of the main political and legal issues regarding the electoral reform process.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to francesca_giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Development Plans with Experience in Pacific Region (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The specific objective of this proposal is to assist the Ministry of Finance and Economic Development (National Authorising Officer) and the Ministry of Line and Phoenix Development and other key stakeholders to develop the Line and Phoenix Integrated Development strategy (LPIDS) and associated Action Plan that will guide the future development of the Line and Phoenix Group of Islands.

Location: Tarawa with travel to Kiritimati (briefing and debriefing in Fiji)

Senior Expert in Development Plans with Experience in Pacific Region (Category I)

*Education *- Possess a Masters’ degree in one of the following fields: Rural development; Public Policy, Public Administration, civil engineering or equivalent.

*Experience *

  • At least 12 years of working experience in development plans (formulation, review and implementation) preferably in developing countries;
  • Leadership and communications skills;
  • Ability to work with national experts and local counterparts.
  • Ability to support national capacity building in the area of policy analysis;
  • Demonstrate ability to work in challenging environment, such as Least Developed Countries.
  • Write high quality reports.

The following experience would be a strong asset:

  • Professional experience in Small Islands Developing States such as in the Pacific region.
  • Knowledge of the European Union’s development cooperation and project cycle management.

Language skills The expert should be fluent in speaking and writing English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category II Expert with experience in Justice Sector Development and Reform in Jordan
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The general objective of the present contract is to provide a detailed review and an overall assessment of the implementation of the EU Sector Reform Contract in support to the justice sector reform in Jordan.

Category II Expert with experience in Justice Sector Development and Reform in Jordan

*Education *- Certified university degree, in law, at master equivalent or above (compulsory).

General professional experience - At least 6 years' experience in the sector (s) related to the lot.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 6 years of recent professional experience directly related to justice sector development and reform.
  • Excellent experience in Jordan with justice sector development and reform (necessary).
  • Knowledge of the context of the Jordanian justice sector (necessary).
  • An excellent Knowledge of EU external aid procedures, project cycle management principles, direct budget support methodology and evaluation will be an asset.
  • Experience in working in an international context with experts and local professionals.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

item.title: Deputy Team Leader, Justice Services and Stability for Development (JSS4D), Papua New Guinea
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Please note that there are four deputy team leader positions relating to Community Safety, Family and Sexual Violence, Law and Justice Services and Anti-Corruption. These positions may be shared where possible.

Position Description:

The Deputy Team Leader shall support the Team Leader to achieve the outcomes of the Program. They will primarily be responsible for managing activities in their component areas. They may also be required to provide technical input into other aspects of the program.

ARF Level: D3

Responsibilities:

  • Support in the management and coordination in the achievement of the Program objectives.
  • Working in a collaborative and coordinated manner with relevant agency-advisers, support sector agencies, coordinating bodies and other partners, including at the sub-national and community level, to build capacity to implement the JSS4D program;
  • Encourage and support efforts to improve coordination, coherence and partnerships among sector stakeholders, and to build mutual understanding and engagement with central agencies, at sub-national levels and within communities;
  • Support mechanisms to address service delivery challenges and overarching policy issues such as community and subnational engagement, gender equality and restorative justice;
  • Support law and justice sector managers and staff to participate effectively in sector coordination mechanisms and other forums;
  • Work proactively, in a collaborative manner with other GoA-funded programs, as well as other donors, to enable cross-program learning and coordination, and to ensure effective harmonisation of assistance to the law and justice sector; and
  • Integrate principles of gender equality and gender mainstreaming into capacity building approaches.
  • Ensure quality assurance principles guide the timely preparation and submission of required briefings and reports.

Skills and experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field and / or significant experience.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the role and functions of the justice system and its agencies in a modern democracy.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the range of capacity building approaches and their applicability to different contexts and needs, and commitment to principles of gender equality and gender mainstreaming.
  • Substantial knowledge, skills and experience in the adviser’s designated area of expertise and an understanding of its importance in effecting sustainable organisational change.
  • Experience in a dynamic public sector or other major organisational environment, in particular politically sensitive environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to develop constructive working relationships with a range of government, private sector and community stakeholders.
  • High level policy and analytical skills.
  • High level interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Experience in working successfully in a cross-cultural, multi-lingual environment, particularly in the Pacific would be an advantage.

How to apply: Please send your CV by email to Sarah_Owen@dai.com.

Please note that due to high volumes of applications, we cannot guarantee to respond to each applicant.

Deadline for Application: 27th April 2015 (Recruitment will close once suitable candidates have been identified)
